blocks.text: Let $m$, and $n$, be the end fixing couples; then to keep the system in equilibrium it is necessary to introduce equal and opposite forces P (Fig. 111).

blocks.description: The equation relating bending moment, curvature, and constants during integration.
Integration of the difference in bending moments.

blocks.text: From equations (1) and (2) the values of $m$ and $P$ (and hence $m$) may be found, the integration being graphical (except in a few cases); and it must be emphasised that the integration must be performed most accurately.

blocks.caption: Figure 111: Diagram illustrating the bending moment in the system under the action of forces.
blocks.description: The figure depicts the bending moment in a beam system under applied forces, illustrating the relationship between forces, moments, and deflection.
